features: COMPLETE NUTRITION FOR KIDS WITH GI CONDITIONS: A peptide-based formula for oral or tube feeding, specially designed for kids ages 1-13
IMMUNE SYSTEM SUPPORT: PediaSure Peptide has prebiotics and antioxidants, vitamins C & E and selenium, to support the immune system

EASY DIGESTION: The only peptide product with structured lipids for easy digestion, improved energy delivery, & enhanced absorption. Suitable for lactose sensitivity. Not for those with cow’s milk protein allergy
#1 RECOMMENDED BRAND: From PediaSure, the #1 brand recommended by pediatricians
HELPS KIDS GROW & THRIVE: PediaSure Peptide provides the right nutrition when it matters most for kids with GI challenges
TASTES GREAT: Available in great-tasting Vanilla and Strawberry flavors and Unflavored
body.description: PediaSure Peptide provides complete, balanced nutrition for tube-feeding kids ages 1-13 with GI conditions. It’s a peptide-based formula with prebiotics, antioxidants, vitamins C & E and selenium, to support the immune system. PediaSure Peptide is the only peptide product with structured lipids for easy digestion, improved energy delivery, and enhanced absorption. From PediaSure, the #1 brand recommended by pediatricians.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: PediaSure Peptide provides complete and balanced nutrition to support growth development and improved energy delivery. It has prebiotics and antioxidants (vitamins C & E and selenium) to support the immune system, and DHA & lutein for brain and eye development. PediaSure Peptide is an easy-to-digest formula for a wide range of conditions and symptoms: Malabsorption, impaired GI function, chronic diarrhea, short bowel syndrome, failure to thrive, malnutrition, critical care, transition from TPN, Crohn’s disease, cerebral palsy, cystic fibrosis, and maldigestion. PediaSure Peptide is a nutritionally complete, peptide-based formula that is used for: sole- source nutrition, supplemental nutrition, oral or tube feeding.

PediaSure Peptide 1.0 Cal PediaSure Peptide 1.5 Cal Vital Peptide 1.5 Cal Description Nutritionally complete, peptide-based formula for the nutrition needs of children ages 1-13 with GI conditions. A calorically dense, nutritionally complete, peptide-based formula for the nutrition needs of children ages 1-13 with GI conditions. Nutritionally complete, peptide-based formula for the nutrition needs of patients ages 14+ with GI conditions. Serving Size 8 fl oz 8 fl oz 8 fl oz Calories 237 356 355 Total Fat 9.6g 14.4g 13.5g Protein 7g 10.7g 16g Prebiotic Fiber 0.7* 1g* 1.4g* Vitamins & Minerals 25 25 25 DHA Omega-3 32mg 32mg Flavors Vanilla, Strawberry, Unflavored Vanilla Vanilla *Dietary fiber supplied by short-chain fructooligosaccharides

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what it is
reviews.reviewText: The unflavored was closest to to the flavor of her previous formula and had the least amount of added sugar, which I liked. This always came very quickly, which I appreciate as this is my child’s main form of nutrition.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2021
reviews.reviewText: These have double the calories of normal pediasure and lower sugar. Great option for if you have a kid in the lower weight percentage that has GI issues. My kid has to take miralax every day to make sure he doesn't get backed up. This seems to be a little easier on his belly, but it's thicker than his normal pediaure. I started pouring into a cut and giving him half mixed with regular milk and stirring in the miralax (and doing the same for night without the miralax added).I like the lower sugar and high calories for my skinny picky eater with tummy issues.However....the price is INSANE. We could never afford to keep our kid on this. Hopefully those that absolutely need this one can get it covered by insurance.We'll continue to buy regular pediasure from costco when it goes on sale.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I got this for kids with GI conditions
reviews.reviewText: Getting nutritious drinks for kids with GI problems is expensive. This is a peptide based, has prebiotics and lots of protein. I will be donating this to the local charity that distributes food and supplies the homeless with much needed foods. This can be used as a drink or for tube fed youngsters. This has Peptide 1.5

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great nutrition, but taste and price are insane
reviews.reviewText: High-calorie, dense, nutritional product for your baby's diet. It provides daily vitamins along with other calories and proteins if consumed regularly.My kid didn't like the flavor. I tried to mix it with other liquids like water, milk, or juice, but she keeps rejecting the flavor. I was trying to serve this in the mornings, but it feels bad to make her associate bad flavors with a high nutritional diet.I would have loved this product if my girl had liked the taste. To me, the price is not worth the experience.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great if you do the dairy thing
reviews.reviewText: These are also appropriate to give to young kids without any special health needs. They contain lower sugar than regular Pediasure, so if you can get them started on these, in my opinion it is a better option. In my opinion, they taste almost exactly like the regular Pediasures, only a very slight difference.These contain corn maltodextrin if there are any allergy concerns, but Pedisure does provide a similar shake that is made with rice maltodextrin instead.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Not completely broken down formula
reviews.reviewText: My son has dairy allergy, gastroenterologist specialist recommended this product. This product is not completely broken down. My son threw up with this formula. The formula being the only dietary change the formula is the problem.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2022
reviews.reviewText: My 4 yr old son does not having a feeding tube but due to his autism he has a very limited diet (6-8 foods he will eat and none are high calorie or nutrient dense). Along with vitamins he also drinks classic pediasure for a caloric and vitamin boost. He did NOT like the flavor of this. However, I found that if I mixed it with milk or water he would drink it. I asked his nutritionist about this product and she said if he will drink it than it’s a great way to get added calories/nutrition in him. It’s also much lower in sugar than the tradition version. I can see this being very beneficial for fd children. I do not see this product useful for most children as it’s specifically designed for very specific dietary needs. If your child has special needs then this might be a good option (if dr approved) for their dietary and weight maintenance needs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High-calorie kid nutrition drink
reviews.reviewText: The PediaSure Peptide 1.5 cal is a high-calorie drink with the smooth and good tastes, and my son likes the flavor. In addition to providing daily vitamins, this bottle of beverage has 356 calories and a protein content of 10.7g, which is higher than normal whole milk. It is also rich in vitamins that are not available in whole milk, similar to DHA and lutein, which grow the brain and protects the eyes. But the drink sugar content is lower than whole milk only 2 g each bottle. It also provides probiotics and fiber to promote digestion. Due to the vitamins contained in this drink, I will halve my son's daily multivitamin intake. But I still give him daily VD intake to improve his calcium absorption.
